title: Deaf Education
banerDescription: Gain qualifications to work with deaf and hard of hearing individuals, supporting their education and rehabilitation.
description:
• Individuals with qualifications to teach subjects or conduct classes, but lacking preparation in special education
  • Individuals with preparation in special education who want to obtain additional preparation in special education
  • Teachers, educators, psychologists interested in working with people with hearing impairments
description2: The aim of the studies is to equip students with specialized knowledge and qualifications to work with deaf and hard of hearing children and youth in kindergartens, special schools, integrated and mainstream schools, as well as in psychological and pedagogical counseling centers, Polish Association of the Deaf counseling centers, and early intervention centers.
description3: Students gain qualifications and competencies to work with people with hearing impairments and resulting speech disorders. During the studies, students will acquire practical knowledge and skills related to effective communication with deaf or hard of hearing individuals, thanks to appropriately selected and available means, proper diagnosis, and therapy.

topics.title: Anatomy and physiology of the voice and hearing organs
Elements of laryngology, otorhinolaryngology, and phoniatrics
Basic legal regulations for education and rehabilitation of people with hearing impairments
Early development support for children with hearing impairments
Rehabilitation and education of adults with hearing impairments
Methods of support and therapy for people with hearing impairments
Methodology of teaching students with hearing impairments in preschool and early school education
Methodology of teaching children and youth with hearing impairments

faculty: Classes are conducted by experienced practitioners in the fields of deaf education, audiology, speech therapy, and psychology, with many years of experience working with deaf and hard of hearing individuals.
practices:
• Internship I covers 60 hours and is carried out in semester 1.
  • Internship II covers 120 hours and is carried out in semester 3.
  • Internships can be carried out in educational institutions, psychological and pedagogical counseling centers, early intervention centers, and other institutions working with people with hearing impairments.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes is based on activity during classes, completion of individual modules, implementation of internships, and preparation of a diploma thesis.
jobOpportunities:
Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:

  • Teachers in special, integrated, and mainstream schools
  • Specialists in psychological and pedagogical counseling centers
  • Employees of Polish Association of the Deaf counseling centers
  • Therapists in early intervention centers
  • Deaf educators in educational and rehabilitation institutions
invite: Gain the qualifications and skills necessary to work with deaf and hard of hearing individuals, supporting their education and rehabilitation.
